page.title: 20Grandparents' Memories
page.content: Our school day began at 9.00 a.m. in 1930. We had morning break at 11.00 to 11.15 a.m., when we had milk. We were sent home at 12 noon for our dinner unless it was too far to walk. School recommenced at 1.15 p.m.. Afternoon break was from 2.15 to 2.30 p.m. and we went home at 3.25 p.m.. The day started with prayers and a Scripture lesson. We had Sums, Drill (P.E.), History, English and Reading. In the afternoon girls were taught to sew, wash and iron clothes. Boys learned gardening and woodwork. Punishments were a soap pill or the cane. There were examinations for the Bishop's Prize. If we won a scholarship at 10 years old we would have to walk to Bletchington Station (2 miles) to catch the train into Oxford. This was our life style then.
